titleInfo.title: Charles Henry Niehaus and the Forrest Monument

mods.abstract: This is a collection of letters, photographs, newspaper articles and entries made in the Forrest Monument Association Minutes Book, in chronological order, pertaining to the funding, design, execution, and installation of the Gen. N.B. Forrest equestrian statue in Forrest Park. The design phase began with the awarding of the contract to sculptor Charles Henry Niehaus in 1901. Niehaus's tireless effort to create a statue befitting the "Wizard of the Saddle" is a worthy story which unfolds in this collection. Some pages of the minutes book were missing or were cut from the book, so there will be gaps in time. This collection would not have been possible without the contributions of many individuals who cherish history and art.

relatedItem.abstract: A collection of all things Memphis... a little bit of this, a little bit of that. The M Files is a great place to find portraits and newspaper clippings, but also so much more. As the clippings from the Memphis Information File are digitized, they will be added to The M Files, but so will the smaller manuscript collections and most of the items used to create the topical digital displays in the Memphis Room.
